full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 Form -215B (Rev. 4-1-68) NITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE RECORD OF SWORN STATEMENT IN AFFIDAVIT FORM AFFIDAVIT IN RE: Suey Gee FONG FILE NO. A7 298 161 EXECUTED AT Los anzoles, California DATE 1115/68 Before the following officer of the U.S. Immigration and Naturalization Service: Loyd L. Netherlin, Investigator in the Chinese language. Interpreter J. H. May used. I, Suoy Goe FONG . acknowledge that the above-named officer has identified himself to me as an officer of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service, authorized by law to administer oaths and take testimony in connection with the enforcement of the Immigration and Nationality laws of the United States. He has informed me that he desires to take my sworn statement regarding: my right to be and remain in the United States He has told me that my statement must be freely and voluntarily given and has advised me of these rights: "You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can be used against you in court, or in any immigration or administrative proceeding. You have the right to talk to a lawyer for advice before we ask you any questions and to have him with you during questioning. If you cannot afford a lawyer, one will be appointed for you before any questioning if you wish. If you decide to answer questions now without a lawyer present, you will still have the right to stop answering at any time. You also have the right to stop answering at any time until you talk to a lawyer." I am willing to make a statement without anyone else being present. I swear that I will tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth, so help me, God. Being duly sworn, I make the following statement: Ny name is Suery Gee FONG. My married name is Suay Gee WONG. I live at 1416 3rd Ave., Los Angeles, Calif. 90019. I help in my husband's laundry at 1800 West 8th St., Los Angeles, California. I was born on 9/17/14 at Wing on Chuan, TSD., China and I an ceitizen of China. My parents FONG Sau Kuan and LEE Shee were natives and citimens of China, both are deceased. My only entry into the United St tes SEX was at San Francisco, California on October 5, 1919 when I was admitted as an immigrant. I immigrated as the wife of a United States citison.
